data.title: Excellent
data.text: We stopped in as we were passing through on a road trip.   The filet was better than expected and reasonably priced.   Martini was also excellent.  Service was also excellent.  Recommended.

data.title: Eating Out
data.text: We eat out a lot and try different places. We like the Long Horn because it nice a cozy. We drive quite a distant to eat there we like it so much. The people are very friendly and helpful

data.title: Great from start to finish
data.text: We went to this steakhouse for our anniversary.  Everyone was friendly and accommodating from the hostess to the guy at the bar then our waitress and next the manager.  Our food was very good.  We had the mushroom, Parmesan crusted filet mignon.  The salad and bread where good as well.  I would recommend this place for a nice evening out.

data.title: BY FAR OUR SECOND MOST FAVORITE RESTAURANT - STEAKS AT THEIR BEST
data.text:
Located on West Bell Road just west of North Litchfield Road (beware of traffic detour for construction of a new bridge over Grand Avenue), the Longhorn Steakhouse is our second most 
favorite restaurant in the Phoenix area, after Carrabba's Italian Grill (just next door). We have eaten at many of the LongHorn locations in Arizona, in Florida, in Georgia, in Tennessee, and in Texas. My wife and I like to split an order of the slow roasted 12 oz Prime Rib steak ($21) served with salad, baked potato, and Horseradish Sauce. The favorite appetizer the Bison Meatballs ($9) and The Cheddar Stuffed Mushrooms ($9). Everything about the LongHorn is great, the locations, the ambiance, the parking, the service and above all the quality of the steaks. Because the quality of the steaks in other restaurants has deteriorated, we seldomly order a steak--just a lot of disappointments, particularly in Southern California. There are good steakhouses but we can not afford to spend $30 to $40 per steak. This why we prefer the quality and the prices at the LongHorn Steakhouse. When busy, the service can be slow.

data.title: A good place
data.text: Saturday evening around 6:30 pm one can expect a good place to be busy and it was, but we were seated within 15 minutes.    Servers travelled at great speed around their allotted tables with good humor.  The ribeye steak was superb.   Recommended

data.title: Very good meal and experience
data.text: My wife and I visit Longhorn Steakhouse every six months or so. Every time we visit we sit at the bar to enjoy our meal. We routinely order the Top Sirloin steak with sides. Each time the steak is prepared exactly as we had ordered. The food is delivered hot and well presented. The steaks are very good with a tasteful amount of seasoning to add to the flavor of the steak instead of overpowering it. The service we receive at the bar is excellent and we enjoy chatting with the bar tender while we are visiting. I highly recommend this restaurant for the food, service, atmosphere and price.

data.title: before the  play
data.text:
A good place to stop before the theater . the service was great ,fast and courteous. .
the food was excellent and the server was excellent. This was a good start to our evening.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: I have been to this restaurant several times,but the last 2 times I have been dissatisfied. They cannot seem to accommodate very well and twice now the steak I ordered came out less then warm. We have decided not to go back until they get the kitchen staff and the seating people straight. We asked to have a 30 minute drink at the bar, I ensured they understood as I said it twice and within mins. Of having a drink they buzzed me. After that it was an extreme hardship getting a table for nearly an hour. We finally had to leave the bar and hover to get seated. Why they don't reserve tables for people there having drinks is beyond me. Then for the second time the food was not hot. The bartenders were great and the table service was also great. Seems to be the front staff and kitchen that are an issue. Hope this helps restaurant mgmt and potential diners.

data.title: Good food, poor service
data.text: Restaurant didn't have enough staff to manage the service. Waiter was running around not able to serve us our dinner. The table wasn't cleared of the starter plates until we asked them to be removed.

data.title: Really good food!
data.text: We were a table of 14 -- not an easy task for the waiters, but they did great.  We shared some appetizers, each ordered something for dinner, and shared several desserts.  All went well.  It was all tasty; I enjoyed my short ribs.  We'll go back, for sure.

data.title: Anniversary Celebration
data.text: A 25th Anniversary dinner and we could have gone anywhere for dinner (trip later) and decided to have a "real dinner" at the LongHorn. We've been in the bar for HH previously but never a dinner. We LOVED it! The server even asked us if we were there for a special occasion (we shyly declined to answer - HA!). Service was excellent only surpassed by the quality of the food. It was a delightful experience. If you haven't tried this place for steak, it's a must-do.

data.title: Great meal, great service, great price!
data.text: What's not to like? A popular chain restaurant for good reason, with very good food and excellent service. Our entire family really enjoyed ourselves here.

data.title: Great food and great service
data.text:
The food has always been good. The service even better. Nice atmosphere inside. Clean.
We prefer booths and they have a number of them.

data.title: Bob G
data.text: MY NEW WIFE. Jeanine and I had a $3 coupon for lunch so we enjoyed our meal with our wonderful hostess, Chelsea. We shared the Flo's Filet and lobster tall had a raspberry smoothie and the shrimp and lobster soup and garden salad From previous experience of way too spicy Chelsea suggested we order no spice or marinade it was perfect! we ordered the fried shrimp appetizer(warning do not eat the spicy peppers unless you can handle the spice). For desert we ordered the trio of cheesecake, brownie and cinnamon flavored pie. All in all a wonderful meal, a charming hostess, a great lunch with wonderful ambiance.YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WITH LONGHORN RESTAURANT OR THE DARDEN CHAIN.  BOB G

data.title: Best Steak house in Surprise
data.text: Well went to LongHorn not expecting too much and we were pleasantly surprised, let me tell you the staff were very nice but they did seem a little short staffed and our server had several tables to take care of, steak came out as ordered and seasoned well, sides were OK but nothing to write about, considering how busy our server was he tried to be attentive to our needs, all in all a very clean restaurant and great food, this place is well needed in surprise.

data.title: Porterhouse for two
data.text: We had the Porterhouse for 2 and it was delicious.  Seasoning was perfect.  It was a bit under cooked for our preference, but really good none the less. Spinach side was good as was baked potato.

data.title: Great Prime Rib
data.text: We went there for our 42 anniversary and wanted to have Prime Rib, was a good choice, it was so good, nice portion andwas so flavorful. The waiter was very attentive. My husband order a Long Island Ice tea and he said it was the best one he ever had, I have to agreee. Dinner was very nice and when we were done we told the waiter that it was our anniversary and a few minutes later he came back with a complimentary dessert and a card signed by all the staff, was such a nice surprise. Thanks for making it so a wondrful evening.

data.title: Delightful surprise in Surprise!
data.text:
Went for early dinner on Saturday.  Our waitress was friendly, attentive and knew her menu.  We all had steaks--fillet, ribeye, prime rib.  All steaks cooked perfectly and so tender and juicy.  Didn't expect perfect steaks from a chain.  
Will definitely return for more.

data.title: Steak House
data.text: A great place for steak. Manager and wait staff are so friendly. Good drinks really busy but they get you in fast. My family loved this place. Kids welcome.

data.title: Five Stars For Alejandro
data.text: Have eaten at Longhorn's many, many times over the years and have never had a bad meal. "Foodies" can pooh-pooh chains all they want, but what this company does, it does well. That being said, what turned a standard four star dinner into five was the very gracious service of Alejandro. The restaurant was obviously short staffed on a busy Saturday night, and he was having to move constantly to keep up, but he never missed a beat, never lost his smile and never left the off-the-wall requests of my elderly aunt (what is it about turning 70 that makes not messing with the menu an impossibility?) fluster him. He bought the place the 5th star and I thank him! Oh, and the 4 Flo's Filets for the table were all cooked perfectly, tender and favorable!
